Key Match Events: Jacob Stallings’ RBI double in the ninth inning helped the Colorado Rockies beat the Detroit Tigers 4-2.
Brendan Rodgers led off the ninth with a single and took second on a passed ball.
Jake Cave made it 4-2 with a long sacrifice fly.
Tyler Kinley pitched the ninth inning, retiring Zach McKinstry with runners at the corners for his 12th save.
Jordan Beck hit a third-inning homer for the Rockies.
Spencer Torkelson put the Tigers ahead with a two-run double in the fourth.
Riley Greene made a leaping catch at the wall to take away a two-run home run from Ezequiel Tovar.
Charlie Blackmon tied the game with a pinch-hit infield single off Sean Guenther.
Seth Halvorsen picked up his first major-league win with a scoreless eighth.
Post-Match Reflections: Jacob Stallings commented on the end of an 11-day road trip and facing the likely AL Cy Young winner.
Rockies manager Bud Black praised the win against a strong team and acknowledged Skubal's performance.
Tigers manager A.J. Hinch noted the team's offensive struggles and praised Ryan Feltner's performance.
Spencer Torkelson expressed disappointment in the loss and determination to come back stronger.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tigers pitcher Tarik Skubal was hit in the right hand by a line drive but continued to play after being checked by the training staff.
Rockies manager Bud Black was ejected by home-plate umpire Alfonso Marquez after Spencer Torkelson's at-bat.
